body_html: @emerali I am still trying to understand how sparse tensor can be useful in RBM. Can I ask which part of the model is sparse, weights or data? And if we support backward for sparse ops, gradient is going to be sparse and thus might not be the "true" gradients. If might also be helpful if you can post a snippet of your model that needs the sparse tensor.

body: @emerali I am still trying to understand how sparse tensor can be useful in RBM. Can I ask which part of the model is sparse, weights or data? And if we support backward for sparse ops, gradient is going to be sparse and thus might not be the "true" gradients. If might also be helpful if you can post a snippet of your model that needs the sparse tensor.
